name: PORT (DOS only)
description: Use this command to output a byte or string of bytes to a specific computer port.

parameters.name: portnum
parameters.description: The actual computer port number. Normally port numbers are in hex form, this must be in decimal, i.e., port 200h is 512 decimal.

parameters.name: giving/receiving_fld
parameters.description: The field that contains the value to be output to the port or input from the port. If you are using a 16550 UART you can have a FLD buffer of more than 1 character, otherwise, you should use get/receive only one character at a time. This command will attempt to get/send the same number of characters as the size of this field.

parameters.name: IN/OUT
parameters.description: IN gets characters from the port, OUT sends characters out the port.
